recipient_justification:
The Newborn Hearing Grant bearing FAIN 20NU50DD000064 aims to develop a comprehensive and coordinated statewide Early Hearing Detection and Intervention (EHDI) system of care targeted towards ensuring that newborns and infants are receiving appropriate and timely services, including screening, evaluation, diagnosis and early intervention. The goal will be accomplished by focusing efforts on 1) engaging health care professionals and families in learning communities to increase knowledge of the EHDI system, 2) ensuring that children who are deaf or hard of hearing have access to the necessary referral(s), care coordination and pertinent services that will support language acquisition, and 3) addressing the importance of families within the EHDI system, and improving family engagement, partnerships, and leadership within the EHDI system.  

These funds were utilized for program staff payroll and related benefits directly via contractor from the grant awarded 4/01/2025. These expenses are necessary to meet the grant’s required deliverables

recipient_justification: These expenditures were incurred in accordance with the award terms and conditions for 19NU50CK000510ASA2C6.  The Advanced Molecular Detection (AMD) program is developing applications to protect America’s health and building capacity in national, state, and local public health laboratories. Modernizing infectious disease laboratories, training staff, and expanding the application of these new technologies will ensure that Americans have the strongest protection against infectious disease threats. The purpose of this award is to support sequencing and analytic capacity building in microbial genomics and bioinformatics as well as to further the development of AMD capacity in local health departments.  See 5/01/2025 grant message for an expense category breakdown.

Nevada used the funds per the approved federal grant budget in full compliance with Grant #NU58DP007499-02. This draw is requesting reimbursement for cost inccured to the State of Nevada, DHHS, Division of Public and Behavorial Helath in support of this project from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. recipient_justification: These expenditures were incurred in accordance with the award terms and conditions for 19NU50CK000510AMD2C6.  The Advanced Molecular Detection (AMD) program is developing applications to protect America’s health and building capacity in national, state, and local public health laboratories. Modernizing infectious disease laboratories, training staff, and expanding the application of these new technologies will ensure that Americans have the strongest protection against infectious disease threats. The purpose of this award is to support sequencing and analytic capacity building in microbial genomics and bioinformatics as well as to further the development of AMD capacity in local health departments.  See 5/01/2025 grant message for an expense category breakdown.

recipient_justification: Payment request for Epidemiology & Laboratory Capacity (ELC), for Supplies (Fisher Scientific, $80.05). This request covers 4/23/25 - 4/28/25, pursuant to the Temporary Restraining Order in Colorado et al. v. HHS et al. (1:25-cv-121, Dist R.I.), which requires that HHS “immediately cease withholding any funds” based on previously issued terminations and to “make such funds available and process all payments as if the [terminations] had not been issued.”

Texas Comptroller provides the following description for travel expenditure object codes used for the following:

Expenditure object 7101 - Travel In-State - Public Transportation Fares - To record the payment of public transportation fare costs incurred during in-state travel by state employees, board or commission members and elected/appointed officials on state business. Includes payments made directly to public transportation companies or credit card issuers by state agencies for transportation expenses of its employees, officials and board members. Public transportation fares include: Commercial air, Railroad, Bus, Car rental, Taxi, Limousine, Boat, Subway, Bicycle, and Transportation network company.

recipient_justification: DATA MODERNIZATION - As part of the “Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act” or the “CARES Act” of 2020, ELC is awarding a total of $200 million to our recipient base in a program-initiated component funding under Project C2: Data Modernization of CK19-1904, henceforth ‘Data Modernization - COVID’. The intention of this funding is to accelerate recipient’s implementation of data modernization efforts, including core data modernization infrastructure, implementation of electronic case reporting (eCR), and modernization of the National Vital Statistics System (NVSS) to move towards faster, more automated sharing of vital statistics between the state and national levels. Monitoring the indicators associated with these activities is intended to assist State, local, and territorial governments in efforts to achieve data modernization goals, assuring faster and more complete data sharing across the public health data ecosystem. Implement and sustain data modernization efforts.

recipient_justification:
This request is not to receive additional funds.  This request is to make necessary adjustments to the subaccounts.  Only requesting $1 from the base award  in order to make the subaccount adjustment because the net draw on PMS cannot be zero. 

In preparing the final FFR reports, the cash lines 10a. through 10.c. in the FFR on PMS did not balance with the expenditures being reported in line 10.e for these subaccounts.  We identified where the incorrect subaccount was chosen by mistake when processing a previous draw down.   This adjustment is necessary to draw the funds from the correct subaccount where the expenses occurred so the final FFRs can be submitted in PMS.

recipient_justification: Returning federal funds due to a credit posting from 4/23/2025 to 4/29/2025. The purpose of this funding is to accelerate recipient’s implementation of data modernization efforts, including core data modernization infrastructure, implementation of electronic case reporting (eCR), and modernization of the National Vital Statistics System (NVSS) to move towards faster, more automated sharing of vital statistics between the state and national levels. Monitoring the indicators associated with these activities is intended to assist State, local, and territorial governments in efforts to achieve data modernization goals, assuring faster and more complete data sharing across the public health data ecosystem.
